sentence.Network_en: Play resumed quickly after the stoppage.
sentence.Network_cn: 比赛中断后不久又继续进行。

sentence.Network_cn: 乌克兰激进的矿工们已经投票决定下个月罢工一天。

entry.def: When there is a stoppage, people stop working because of a disagreement with their employers.

example.ex: Mineworkers in the Ukraine have voted for a one-day stoppage next month.
example.tran: 乌克兰矿工们已投票决定下个月罢工一天。

entry.tran: (足球等体育运动中的)中断比赛，暂停
entry.def: In football and some other sports, when there is a stoppage, the game stops for a short time, for example because a player is injured. The referee may add some extra time at the end of the game because of this.

means.word_mean: 1. the state of inactivity following an interruption;

sentences.sentence: "during the halt he got some lunch"
"the momentary stay enabled him to escape the blow"
"he spent the entire stop in his seat"

means.word_mean: 2. an obstruction in a pipe or tube;

sentences.sentence: "we had to call a plumber to clear out the blockage in the drainpipe"
"the third baseman made some remarkable stops"
"his stoppage of the flow resulted in a flood"

sentences.en: All these stoppages are costing the company a fortune.
sentences.cn: 所有这些罢工事件使公司损失了一大笔财富。
